title: Where to watch CIF football championship games: Schedule, channel, live stream for California HS finals
description: It's NorCal vs. SoCal as 15 state titles are handed out this weekend. Here's how to watch them all.
fullText:
Where to watch CIF football championship games: Schedule, channel, live stream for California HS finals originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Fifteen title games at three sites in two days: It's football heaven for fans in California and beyond as north and south clash in the CIF State Football Championship Bowl Games.

The Open Division matchup will command the most attention in the state and around the country. Sporting News Top 25 No. 15 Santa Margarita, led by first-year coach Carson Palmer, looks for its first title since 2011 against perennial power De La Salle, which is 12-0 and ranked No. 25 nationally.

The Spartans have won a record seven state championships but it has been 10 years since they last raised the trophy. Close on their heels is Folsom, which will play for the 1-AA crown behind BYU-bound QB Ryder Lyons in an attempt to win the school's sixth title, which would break a tie with Mater Dei for second on the all-time list.

Another CIF Bowl Game fixture looking to add to the trophy case is McClymonds. The Oakland school has seemingly played in just about every division there is and this year will vie for the 3-A title, which would be the Warriors' fifth overall and first since 2021.

It should be a thrilling couple days of football across the state. Here's how to watch all the action.

TV channel: Spectrum News, Spectrum SportsNet

Five CIF state championship games will air regionally on Spectrum News or Spectrum SportsNet. Fans outside the Spectrum footprint can stream those games on the NFHS Network, which will also have exclusive broadcasts of the other 10 state finals. See the full schedule below.

The NFHS Network offers two basic plans: an Annual Pass ($6.67 per month) or a Monthly Pass ($13.99 per month). These plans give subscribers the ability to watch live sporting events and create clips of their favorite moments from games.

Buena Park High School Stadium: 4-AA, 4-A, 5-AA, 6-A, 7-A

title: Manchester City look to have locked in on their preferred right-back to add to Pep Guardiola’s squad
description: Looking ahead to the January and summer transfer windows, there look to be two main positions that Manchester City will look to strengthen. It would not be a surprise to see City move for another wing...
fullText:
Looking ahead to the January and summer transfer windows, there look to be two main positions that Manchester City will look to strengthen. It would not be a surprise to see City move for another winger or attacking player in January. Omar Marmoush will be unavailable for an extended period of time due to the African Cup of Nations. City could benefit from signing another attacking player next month. It would also seem that Pep Guardiola’s squad would benefit from signing a right-back. That move appears to be one that will likely take place in the summer and there is one player who is emerging as City’s main target for the right-back role.

Two new reports have emerged that state that Manchester City could move for Tino Livramento next summer. The first comes from Craig Hope for the Daily Mail. Hope reports that Tino Livramento is set to delay any decision on signing a contract extension with Newcastle United until near the end of this season. Furthermore, Hope reports that Livramento’s long-term future is uncertain. Hope further reports that Manchester City have a strong interest in signing the England international. Lastly, it is also reported that if Newcastle United qualify for next season’s UEFA Champions League, Tino Livramento could sign a contract extension with Newcastle. Newcastle United are determined to keep Livramento at the club as per Craig Hope’s report.

Jordan Campbell has reported for The Athletic that Manchester City decided not to pursue a move for Tino Livramento last summer as they deemed a move for the England international as out of reach. Furthermore, Campbell reports that Tino Livramento is highly appreciated as a player at City. Campbell also reports that City could have to pay near enough to £100 million to sign Tino Livramento from Newcastle United if he doesn’t sign a contract extension with Eddie Howe’s side.

All indications are that Manchester City have identified Tino Livramento as the primary transfer target to come in at right-back. Matheus Nunes has done a superb job playing in the position this season. Nunes’ game has improved and there is no reason why he cannot remain as Manchester City’s first-choice right-back for this season. Abdukodir Khusanov can step in for Nunes when required. It would be almost impossible for City to sign Tino Livramento in January so the England international would look to be a summer target for City.

Based on Craig Hope and Jordan Campbell’s reports it seems to now be a matter of when City will make their move to sign Tino Livramento from Newcastle, not if they will make that particular move. There is now too much noise to suggest otherwise. Livramento would almost be the ideal signing for City. He is a homegrown player blessed with tremendous technical ability and he is a tremendous defender at either left or right-back. He is also the ideal age to arrive at City as an established player with his best years ahead of him. Livramento ticks every box required of a potential Manchester City signing.

As of right now, unless Livramento extends his contract with Newcastle, it seems that City will move to sign Tino Livramento. It will likely be a move that Manchester City will pursue next summer. Whether or not that move will be successful remains to be seen. But it would appear that City have identified their top target to sign for the right-back position.

title: Georgia offers Michigan State 4-star WR commit Samson Gash
description: Detroit Catholic Central four-star wide receiver Samson Gash is one of the few unsigned blue-chippers left in the 2026 cycle. The 6-foot pass-catcher has been committed to Michigan State since June 24, but he decided not to sign earlier this month as the Spartans had a change at head coach and elsewhere on the staff. […]
fullText:
Detroit Catholic Central four-star wide receiver Samson Gash is one of the few unsigned blue-chippers left in the 2026 cycle.

The 6-foot pass-catcher has been committed to Michigan State since June 24, but he decided not to sign earlier this month as the Spartans had a change at head coach and elsewhere on the staff. The in-state program still holds his commitment, but other programs are in the mix, too.

Another notable offer came through for Gash on Friday. He took to social media to announce an offer from James Coley and the Georgia Bulldogs:

Blessed to receive an offer from Georgia!!

@CoachColey@KirbySmartUGA@DHill39@AllenTrieu@GregSmithRivals@SWiltfong_@adamgorneypic.twitter.com/cIFyIumAHB

WR (@GashSamson) December 13, 2025

With UGA in the mix, it could throw another wrinkle in the recruitment of Gash, which has taken multiple turns this fall. Before the coaching change in East Lansing, Michigan State was already trying to fend off Alabama.

The Crimson Tide were in pursuit of Gash this fall and a flip looked to be probable, but the SEC program took its foot off the gas. After the firing of Michigan State head coach Jonathan Smith, Gash began to draw interest from West Virginia.

At the end of the National Signing Period last week, it looked the Mountaineers were in the driver’s seat. Earlier this week, though, Penn State and new head coach Matt Campbell jumped in with an offer. Gash’s father, Sam Gash, played for the Nittany Lions.

“This offer means a lot to me. It’s been a long time coming,” Gash told BWI. “I’ve been up there a few times and I know the program is in great hands with this new Iowa State staff that I like and trust a lot after they were recruiting me a little bit at Iowa State.”

Georgia will now look to make its presence felt for Gash, who won’t put pen to paper until February. The Bulldogs lost four-star WR Brady Marchese during the signing period as he flipped to Michigan. They did still sign a pair of four-star wideouts last week in Craig Dandridge and Ryan Mosley.

Michigan State, now led by Pat Fitzgerald, still signed 19 prospects last week. It would love to keep Gash in the mix, too, but it won’t be easy.

“It feels really good knowing MSU is in good hands and is a safe option for me and great hire,” Gash told Rivals’ Greg Smith about the Fitzgerald hire.

Gash is the No. 292 overall prospect and No. 46 WR in the 2026 cycle, according to the Rivals Industry Ranking, a weighted average that utilizes all major recruiting media companies. He’s also the No. 6 recruit in Michigan.

title: Rangers sign $14.5 million free agent catcher to replace Jonah Heim
description: Texas has its new backstop.
fullText:
Rangers sign $14.5 million free agent catcher to replace Jonah Heim originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Texas Rangers made the choice earlier in the offseason to cut Jonah Heim loose.

It meant that the Rangers would have to seek out a new starting catcher in free agency, and now they've got their man.

Jansen has signed a two-year deal for $14.5 million, according to ESPN's Jeff Passan.

Jansen is a 30-year old catcher originally from Appleton, Wisconsin. The Blue Jays took him in the 16th round of the 2013 MLB Draft out of high school.

The righty hitter gained pretty solid acclaim as a prospect in the Toronto system and made his MLB debut in 2018. He played his first six-and-a-half seasons with the Blue Jays.

MORE: Christian Yelich shows his puppy a proper appreciation of Tavon Austin

In his Toronto tenure, Jansen had a .733 OPS, hitting 71 home runs in 471 games.

He then spent half a season with the Boston Red Sox to end 2024.

In 2025, Jansen split the year between the Tampa Bay Rays and Milwaukee Brewers.

Jansen had an OPS of .703 with the Rays, then was pretty hot in limited duty with the Brewers, putting up a .779 OPS.

Now, Jansen gets to play for yet another team.

The Rangers now have their catcher depth chart set. They have Kyle Higashioka returning for the second season of his two-year contract signed last winter.

Jansen would likely be the favorite to win the job, but the Rangers can feel good that they have two reliable veterans on hand.

title: Rangers sign Edwin Diaz's All-Star brother to free agent contract
description: Texas is hoping for a rebound here.
fullText:
Rangers sign Edwin Diaz's All-Star brother to free agent contract originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Texas Rangers have signed a former All Star who is the brother of one of this offseason's big free agent moves.

No, they didn't get Edwin Diaz. They got his brother Alexis in a deal reporter by ESPN's Jeff Passan on Friday night.

Alexis is a 29-year old righty who as recently as 2023 was an All-Star closer for the Cincinnati Reds.

He made his MLB debut in 2022 and had a 1.84 ERA in 59 games.

The next season, he saved 37 games, and in 2024, he saved 28 and still had a 3.99 ERA.

MORE: Christian Yelich shows his puppy a proper appreciation of Tavon Austin

The rails fell off quickly in 2025.

Alexis Diaz had a 12.00 ERA in six outings with the Reds before they let him go.

The Dodgers pick him up next, and he had a 5.00 ERA in nine games there before they too let him go.

The Atlanta Braves gave Diaz a quick chance down the stretch, and he had a 10.13 ERA in three outings.

It seems like multiple teams have viewed Alexis Diaz as a worthy reclamation project. His stuff was really good as recently as a couple seasons ago.

Relievers are volatile, and some never get back to their form.

But if the Rangers get Alexis Diaz back to his 2022-23 level, it'll be a huge steal to get him now in free agency.

title: Northwestern vs. Raines: live score, updates, highlights from Florida's FHSAA Class 3A championship
description: The No. 22 Northwestern Bulls will face the Raines Vikings Friday night in Florida's FHSAA Class 3A state championship game
fullText:
Northwestern vs. Raines: live score, updates, highlights from Florida's FHSAA Class 3A championship originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

MIAMI, Florida, Dec. 12 — The Northwestern [Miami, FL] Bulls roll into Florida's FHSAA Class 3A title Friday evening with a 23-game win streak and an undefeated 13-0 record as they look to defend their 2024 state championship at Florida International University's Pitbull Stadium.

Their opponent will look very familiar as they'll face the same Raines [Jacksonville, FL] Vikings' squad they beat, 41-0, in last year's title tilt. Raines also sports a 13-0 record headed into the contest.

Northwestern will be seeking its eight state championship in football while Raines is in the hunt for its fourth football state championship trophy.

Game time is set for 7:30 p.m. EST local.

WATCH ON THE NFHS NETWORK:No. 22 Northwestern [Miami, FL] Bulls vs. Raines [Jacksonville, FL] Vikings

This Raines defense! I've been talking about them all night here, and they get an interception with a big return when Northwestern goes for it on fourth down. After trailing by nine, the Vikings are, amazingly, in business.

With 7:12 to play, Raines finally has some points from the offense, tacking on a field goal. It's important. It gets this back to a one-score game, and a touchdown and PAT could possibly win it.

This was never going to be easy for Raines, and it just got a lot harder as the Vikings' defense finally gives up its first touchdown. Northwestern back firmly in control in a two-score game now.

Well, Raines has finally scored against Northwestern, but it's the only 7 points they have in seven quarters against this Northwestern team the past two years. But, the difference this year is their defense is keeping this thing close. And that defense might have to go and win this thing for them.

Northwestern shakes off the interception and drives down into position for another field goal. But these are still small victories for the Vikings. They're giving their offense every opportunity to go win this game.

Well, the defense for Raines has been keeping them in this game, and now they've given the Vikings the lead on a long interception return. This is a crazy swing, and in seven quarters of play against Northwestern, this is the first points Raines has managed. But this is no anomaly; this is the Viking's 12th defensive touchdown this year.

Northwestern adds another field goal, but Raines' defense is playing tough tonight. They're giving the offense a chance if it can ever get on track.

And the third quarter is just getting under way!

This is looking a lot better than last year, but one important number is the same so far – that goose egg on the Vikings' side of the scoreboard. They lost last year's game 41-0, and through two quarters tonight, the offense still hasn't cracked the code against this stout Bulls' defense.

Raines was finally driving deep in Northwestern's territory, helped along by a pass interference penalty. But then they throw an interception near the 5 yard line with 39 seconds to play in the first half.

Khavon Gipson with a clutch interception for Northwestern. Raines was driving. pic.twitter.com/WKTZkhHnnN

— Adam Lichtenstein (@ABLichtenstein) December 13, 2025

Northwestern was about to score when the running back took a hard lick near the goal line. The ball rolled into the end zone where Raines recovered to take over. The Vikings' defense is bending but not breaking. But they need some help from the offense late in the second quarter.

Raines was pinned deep in its own territory after the turnover on downs. They were forced to punt from their end zone, but Northwestern mishandles the punt, and Raines pounces on it. Northwestern would have had great field position around the Vikings' 30, but instead, the Vikings keep their drive alive.

Northwestern takes their second drive inside the Raines' 5. On fourth and goal, they go for the first down, but the Vikings' defense forces the turnover on downs!

Northwestern puts together a solid drive, but Raines' defense stands tall in the shadow of their own end zone to force a field goal.

Field goal! @mnw_fb scores first. Alex Lima field goal from 24. Good stand inside 10 by Raines.

Miami Northwestern 3, Raines 0, 6:19 1st. pic.twitter.com/Yy2cYhzKfG

— Clayton Freeman (@CFreemanJAX) December 13, 2025

The game is under way in Miami, Florida!

Start time: 7:30 p.m. EST local

The game between Northwestern and Raines is being played at Florida International University's Pitbull Stadium.

WATCH ON THE NFHS NETWORK:No. 22 Northwestern [Miami, FL] Bulls vs. Raines [Jacksonville, FL] Vikings

title: Archbishop Shaw (LA) vs. St. Charles (LA): Live updates, score of Louisiana LHSAA Prep Classic Division II Select championship game
description: Follow along as the Eagles face the Comets
fullText:
Archbishop Shaw (LA) vs. St. Charles (LA): Live updates, score of Louisiana LHSAA Prep Classic Division II Select championship game originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

NEW ORLEANS, LOUISIANA - Two New Orleans-area schools didn’t have far to travel to play for a state title in Division II Select.

Archbishop Shaw takes on St. Charles Catholic to determine the Division II Select champion at the Caesars Superdome as part of the Louisiana High School Athletic Association’s Prep Classic.

LIVE STREAM:Watch Shaw vs. St. Charles live on the NFHS Network ()

It will also be a rematch of a regular season game played on Week 10, with St. Charles claiming a 24-0 win.

Shaw (9-4) is the defending state champion, but had to replace nine starters on offense. But the Eagles are back in familiar territory, and are going through a strong postseason run in which they’ve outscored their foes 114-13, including a 27-0 win against Vandebilt Catholic in last week’s semifinal round.

St. Charles, the top seed in the bracket, comes in at 12-1 after finishing 4-7 the season before. Prior to that, the Comets had been in the state title game for five straight years.

The Comets survived an overtime thriller against University Lab in last week’s semifinal to make it back to the Dome.

Follow The Sporting News correspondent Buck Ringgold (@Bucks_Ballpark) for all of the live updates and scoring from New Orleans.

Scroll down for live score and game updates from kickoff to the postgame. Refresh this page for the latest.

- TOUCHDOWN SHAW. Eagles force a punt late in the quarter, and right before it ends, QB Allen Shaw takes a keeper and has broken free. He goes in from 81 yards out and the Eagles are in the lead. (Shaw, 21-14 | :03, 3rd)

- TOUCHDOWN SHAW. Eagles tie things up as Allen Shaw takes a keeper into the end zone from 8 yards out. But the key play was a fake punt, with the up-back, Ted Reine, passing it to an open Elliott Love for 38 yards to the St. Charles 18. (14-14 | 4:03, 3rd)

- Shaw gets the ball to start the second half but the Eagles are unable to move it, and have to punt it away.

- St. Charles had 105 yards of total offense in the opening half, while Shaw had just 88 yards. It's still anyone's game, though, going into the second half.

- St. Charles forces a punt in the closing seconds of the opening half. Comets may elect to be satisfied with a seven-point lead.

St. Charles Catholic back ahead on two big connections from Landree LeBlanc to Gabriel Kugler.

A third&long that goes a long way. Then the TD a few plays later.

St. Charles Catholic 14, Archbishop Shaw 7.
2Q, 1:44. pic.twitter.com/Z5Sjre2OAi

- Shaw has the ball inside the St. Charles 30 with more than eight minutes to go in the half.

- St. Charles had 35 total yards in the first quarter, while Shaw had 19 total yards.

- Shaw has had to punt on both of its opening two possessions. St. Charles takes over following the second punt in the final moments of the period.

title: Boerne vs. Randle: live score, updates, highlights from Texas UIL Class 5A Division II semifinals
description: The No. 28/SN No. 14 Randle Lions will face off against the Boerne Greyhounds Friday night in the Texas UIL Class 5A Division II semifinals
fullText:
Boerne vs. Randle: live score, updates, highlights from Texas UIL Class 5A Division II semifinals originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

SAN ANTONIO, Texas, Dec. 12 — The Randle Lions have won 30 straight games, heading into Friday night's Texas UIL Class 5A Division II semifinal game at the Alamodome.

They'll face the Boerne [TX] Greyhounds who enter the contest with a 13-1 record.

Randle is looking to defend its 2024 Class 4A state championship with one of the nation's top running backs in their backfield in junior Landen Williams-Callis.

Game time is set for 8 p.m. EST (7 p.m. CST local).

WATCH ON THE NFHS NETWORK:No. 28/SN No. 14 Randle [Richmond, TX] Lions vs. Boerne [TX] Greyhounds

Randle adds a 32-yard field goal.

And that's three quarters in the book. Randle comfortably on its way to return to the state championship game in defense of their 2024 title.

You-know-who scores on a 42-yard run, and Randle is starting to literally run away with this. And the guy doing the running is Landen Williams-Callis. He's got 202 yards and 5 touchdowns ... so far.

They're under way in the third quarter, and it's really just turning into another episode of the Landen Williams-Callis show. He's got his fourth touchdown of the night.

Boerne played about as good as you can expect against this big Randle offense. But that late touchdown has made this a much more formidable effort, and Williams-Callis still has three touchdowns in this game.

Williams-Callis scores his third touchdown of the game from 9 yards out with just 10 seconds remaining before the half. The Lions starting to finally get some separation after getting the Greyhounds' best effort in this first half.

Williams-Callis scores his second touchdown of the game on a short 2-yard run to put the Lions back on top.

Randle is forced to punt from its own end zone, and it is blocked for a safety. Boerne hanging tough with the defending champions tonight.

We've got conflicting info on the score with some reports saying it's 10-7. We'll work to clarify that and update here. The video feed for the game is not working tonight.

With just 5 seconds to play in the first quarter, Boerne gets an answer on the board.

One-hand TD catch! @HoundFootball QB Grant Sweeney finds WR Zach Frasier, who palms it for the Boerne TD! Much needed for the Greyhounds to get on the board.

10-7 Richmond Randle at the end of 1Q.

Winner to the Texas State Championship. pic.twitter.com/GSuRkXecF5

— Nate Ryan (@nateryansports) December 13, 2025

Landen Williams-Callis scores on a 30-yard run. The PAT is no good, but it's all Lions early.

Randle's first drive stalls, but it's close enough for the Lions to put a field goal on the board.

The game is under way in San Antonio!

Start time: 8 p.m. EST {7 p.m. CST local)

The game between Boerne and Randle is being played at the Alamodome.

title: Clayton vs. Grimsley: live score, updates, highlights from North Carolina's NCHSAA Class 7A championship
description: The No. 20/SN No. 17 Grimsley Whirlies will take on the Clayton Comets Friday for North Carolina's NCHSAA Class 7A state championship
fullText:
Clayton vs. Grimsley: live score, updates, highlights from North Carolina's NCHSAA Class 7A championship originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

CHAPEL HILL, North Carolina, Dec. 12 — The Grimsley [Greensboro, NC] Whirlies have won 31 straight games, heading into Friday night's North Carolina NCHSAA Class 7A state championship game.

Standing in their path is the Clayton [NC] Comets who enter the contest with a 12-2 record against the Whirlies who are 14-0 in 2025.

Grimsley is looking to defend its 2024 Class 4A state championship while Clayton is making its first state title game appearance since 1989.

Game time is set for 8 p.m. EST local at the University of North Carolina's Kenan Stadium

WATCH ON THE NFHS NETWORK:No. 20/SN No. 17 Grimsley [Greensboro, NC] Whirlies vs. Clayton [NC] Comets

Clayton commits its third turnover of the third quarter. The Comets are starting to burn out.

In a game where Grimsley's offense has really struggled to find any rhythm, it's the defense that makes the play of the game so far. An interception return for a touchdown gives Grimsley its first two-score lead of the night.

Two early turnovers, one by each team, to start the third quarter. Clayton's offense gave it to Grimsley deep in their own territory, but Faizon Brandon tries to force a throw into a receiver near the goal line. The Comets pick it off and get a decent return to get out of the jam. A very solid effort tonight by Clayton against one of the top two senior quarterback in the entire national Class of 2026.

And the third quarter is under way.

Well, two second-quarter touchdowns have turned this game around. But Clayton is in this, and they've proven so far that they can make plays on both sides of the field.

With just 37 second to play in the first half, Grimsley finally takes its first lead of the night. Faizon Brandon making plays with his feet tonight, too.

Well, it's been tough going for the defending state champions from Grimsley, but they finally get on the board as Faizon Brandon finds Hudson Cooper with a strike in the middle of the field near the goal line. Cooper falls into the end zone on the tackle, and they're back to even in Chapel Hill.

So far, the defending champs are having a tough go of it. They haven't been able to make plays against this Clayton defense, yet. A long way to go, but you have to be happy with that first 12 minutes if you're a Comets' fan.

Clayton jumps on the defending champs early.

They're under way in Chapel Hill, North Carolina!

The game between Clayton and Grimsley is being played at the University of North Carolina's Kenan Stadium.

title: Delphos St. John's Cameron Elwer breaks MAC all-time scoring record in epic 45-point masterpiece
description: A walking bucket.
fullText:
Delphos St. John's Cameron Elwer breaks MAC all-time scoring record in epic 45-point masterpiece originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Midwest Athletic Conference produces some of the best small-school athletes at the high school level anywhere in Ohio.

As far as boys basketball goes, Cameron Elwer of Delphos St. John's now stands alone.

On Friday night, Elwer became the MAC's all-time leading scorer.

Here's a look at the shot that did it:

#ThatMomentWhen@elwer_cameron became the @midwestathletic all time leading scorer. pic.twitter.com/Jui7T1PC42

— Michael Hirn (@MichaelHirnPBP) December 13, 2025

Elwer broke the record previously held by Versailles' Justin Ahrens, which had stood at 2,046 points.

He needed 30 on the night to break the mark. Elwer dropped 45.

The Blue Jays' senior star drilled 11 3-pointers in the process, a special night all around, as St. John's beat MAC rival Minster, 64-44.

Elwer entered this season with major expectations, playing on a roster filled with his brothers and cousins, a whole host of Elwers.

The leading Elwer is bound for Division I Furman after this season. First, he'll put together one final magical season showing the entire MAC what he can do, and hopefully, make a run that shows the rest of the state, too.

Elwer will have plenty of time to expand on his record, and he surely will along a path that includes a lot of winning, too.

title: Papermoon: A Space-Grade Linux for the NewSpace Era
description: Discover Papermoon, the open source project creating a standard, space-grade Linux to replace bespoke software for satellites and spacecraft in the NewSpace era.
fullText:
TOKYO — When I worked for NASA in the 1980s, every satellite and spaceship that went into orbit ran one-off, hand-coded, semi-proprietary programs. This approach was painful, expensive, and sometimes disastrous, as with the loss of the Mars Climate Orbiter in 1999 due to a software blunder.

Things have changed. In his “Space Grade Linux” keynote at the Open Source Summit Japan conference, Ramón Roche, a longtime robotics developer and general manager of the Dronecode Foundation, told how Linux and open source software are becoming the default for every launch — replacing the bespoke, one-off programs of the past.

This change has been coming for a while. By 2013, the International Space Station (ISS) switched out its Windows laptops for Debian Linux machines for mission-critical work. Today, SpaceX’s workhorse rocket, Falcon 9, and its Dragon spacecraft both run Linux. Roche also noted that the first aircraft on another planet, the Ingenuity helicopter on Mars, flew with Linux. Heck, a developer recently managed to run open source Doomon, a European Space Agency (ESA) satellite.

But Roche stressed that one thing has been lacking. A common space Linux platform so that space companies can stop “competing on the plumbing” and start sharing core software infrastructure.

The economic backdrop is a classic space‑tech storyline: It’s cheaper than ever to access orbit, but software complexity and safety requirements keep rising.

“You can launch a satellite for the cost of a nice car,” Roche said, noting that the cost per kilogram is “quickly approaching less than $100 per kilo to ship payload to space,” which in turn fuels a flywheel of more launches, more applications and even “data centers in space.”

What doesn’t scale, he argued, is the way many missions are still engineered as bespoke, one‑off software stacks. “It’s 2025 right now, and we’re still in a phase like 1969,” where missions are one‑off and expensive. That model “was fine back when launches cost millions of dollars, he noted, “but no longer fits the economics of NewSpace.

Space’s harsh realities — radiation‑induced “single set events” that reboot systems without warning, communication delays “measured in minutes,” and the impossibility of “SSH there” to fix a broken satellite — are pushing developers toward robust, well-understood, community‑maintained open source instead of proprietary stacks.

The problem, as Roche sees it, is not whether Linux is the right base layer for autonomous systems, but how it is used.

A survey of practitioners identified Yocto as the “clear winner” among embedded Linux distributions. However, we still have a fragmented landscape of teams “building their own version of Linux from scratch” with “no shared foundational layer,” Roche said.

“Everyone agrees that Linux is the answer,” he said. “But nobody agrees on which Linux.”

That fragmentation looks familiar to Roche, who has spent more than a decade in the drone ecosystem around PX4 and related projects.

“I was there in 2010 when the drone industry looked very similar. Everyone was building on their own stacks, nobody talking to anyone else,” he recalled, describing “years of complicated effort” and “every company reinventing the wheel, incompatible protocols” before the community decided to “stop competing on the plumbing and start competing on innovation.”

In his telling, that shift enabled open source to power “the majority of commercial and professional drones worldwide,” from agriculture and inspection to mapping, search‑and‑rescue, and even defense.

The answer is Papermoon, a proposed space‑grade Linux stack. Roche described it as “an open source project and a new foundation” built around Linux as the “autoplay, middle layer architecture,” licensed under MIT, with a Developer Certificate of Origin rather than contribution agreements “friction.”

On the hardware side, early targets include RISC‑V development boards “like a Raspberry Pi, same price point,” Roche said, alongside space‑designed platforms such as Microchip’s radiation‑tolerant MPSoC, with continuous integration already running “on every commit” and images booting on actual boards.

“This is what you’re getting,” Roche told the audience, arguing that teams who adopt Papermoon are “not starting from zero”— the base layer, build system, and “safety‑aware configuration” represent “months that you don’t need to spend reinventing if you collaborate with us.”

To tackle safety and certification head-on, the project has been incubating inside the Linux Foundation’s Enabling Linux in Safety Applications (ELISA) initiative.  Roche highlighted ELISA vice president Kate Stewart’s work as emblematic of the community Papermoon wants to align with.

“If you’re building safety‑critical systems that run on Linux, there’s no one better to learn from,” he said. “ELISA has been working on this problem since 2019: How do you use Linux in systems where failure means loss of life?”

A year ago, about 30 people met in person at NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC) — my home base when I worked for NASA — with another 40 joining virtually from more than 20 organizations, agencies, and research groups, to “decide the direction for this project,” which Roche framed as “not a maintenance‑only conversation, that’s actual, real commitment.”

The next move, he said, is to “step out of the ELISA incubation and form our own foundation with neutral overheads, member‑driven, the same models that work for automotive grade Linux,” where founding members “help us shape what this becomes: the governance, the roadmap, and standards that we set.”

Roche’s pitch to developers and companies in the room was blunt: Ingenuity “proved Linux belongs in space,” but “the next mission shouldn’t start from scratch.”

“The question is, does every team after this rebuild from zero, or do we give them that foundation?” he asked, positioning Papermoon as that shared base and urging those “building for space” who recognize the pattern from drones and automotive to “come talk to us” and “help us build the foundation for the next era of space.”

title: New Epstein photos released showing Bill Gates, Richard Branson, Donald Trump, and more
description: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee on Friday released never-before-seen images from the estate of late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein
fullText:
Democrats on the House Oversight Committee on Friday released never-before-seen images from the estate of late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, including some featuring powerbrokers like Bill Gates and Larry Summers.

The photos — which also feature President Donald Trump, ex-Trump advisor Steve Bannon, former President Bill Clinton, writer-director Woody Allen, Richard Branson, and Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, formerly Prince Andrew — are a selection of the over 95,000 photos that the Democrats say were provided to the House Oversight Committee pursuant to a subpoena.

Some of the photos also include Ghislaine Maxwell, a onetime partner of Epstein who was convicted of trafficking girls to him for sex. She's currently serving a 20-year prison sentence.

The committee previously released other records obtained from Epstein's estate, including images of his US Virgin Islands home and tens of thousands of emails and text messages between Epstein and other powerful people.

The images themselves aren't indications of wrongdoing.

In many cases, it isn't clear when the photos were taken. Epstein pleaded guilty in 2008 to soliciting an underage girl for prostitution and agreed to register as a pedophile. In 2019, he killed himself in a Manhattan jail while awaiting trial on more severe sex-trafficking charges from federal prosecutors.

The House Oversight Committee's ranking member, Democratic Rep. Robert Garcia of California, said in a statement: "These disturbing photos raise even more questions about Epstein and his relationships with some of the most powerful men in the world."

Representatives for Gates, Summers, Bannon, Clinton, Allen, Branson, and Mountbatten-Windsor did not immediately respond to requests for comment by Business Insider.

White House spokeswoman Abigail Jackson told Business Insider in a statement that House Democrats are once again "selectively releasing cherry-picked photos with random redactions to try and create a false narrative."

The latest release of images comes as the Department of Justice readies to release a trove of Epstein-related documents. The Epstein Files Transparency Act, passed by Congress and signed into law by Trump, requires the Justice Department to make its files related to Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell public by December 19.

"The Trump Administration has done more for Epstein's victims than Democrats ever have by repeatedly calling for transparency, releasing thousands of pages of documents, and calling for further investigations into Epstein's Democrat friends," Jackson said.

Below are some of the 19 images that Democrats on the House Oversight Committee published on Friday:

title: This 'shopping basket' Chanel bag just sold for a record-breaking amount
description: The record-setting sale comes amid a luxury resale boom.
fullText:
It's not just grocery prices that are high — it's also the shopping baskets, or at least some of them.

A Chanel handbag cosplaying as a grocery basket sold for $152,400 at auction on Thursday, breaking brand records.

The piece — the rare, runway silver and black lambskin leather shopping basket bag from 2014 — sold for more than 10 times its low estimate of $15,000 at the online auction from Christie's.

That's a lot of money, but far from the most expensive handbag ever sold.

In July, Hermès' original Birkin bag — worn by Jane Birkin, herself — sold for $10.1 million, becoming the most valuable handbag ever sold at auction. The iconic purse went to a private collector in Japan, who phoned in and won a 10-minute bidding war.

While items selling for millions, or even six figures, may be rare, the luxury resale market is booming.

The secondhand fashion and luxury market is expected to reach $317 billion by 2027, according to a McKinsey report published last month, and it's growing three times as fast as the firsthand market. Secondhand luxury retailers like The RealReal and Fashionphile have recorded double-digit revenue growth this year.

Most luxury resale shoppers are turning to the market to find more affordable options, particularly as handbags from some of the biggest names have experienced significant price hikes over the past few years.

Chanel is one of the worst offenders. The price of its iconic flap bag nearly doubled between 2019 and 2024. This year, the brand increased prices again, hiking those of about 21% of its products by 5% in February, according to research from Citi. Add Trump's tariffs to the mix, and luxury handbags are more expensive than ever.

That said, it's not all deals on the secondhand market. Some savvy shoppers are treating luxury resale as an investment opportunity. Bags from Chanel sold for as much as 30% over their retail value on The RealReal last year.

Classic handbags from brands like Louis Vuitton and Hermès tend to hold their value for years. Some of the most coveted handbags even sell for more on the secondhand market.

title: Amazon Prime Video scraps AI-powered TV show recap after 'Fallout' fallout
description: Almost a month after Prime Video launched AI-powered Video Recaps, viewers said it shared incorrect plot details about season one of "Fallout."
fullText:
Given the length of time it can take for the new season of your favorite TV show to come out, it's understandable that you might want a little video recap of what's happened so far.

Ideally, that recap is accurate.

Fans of Amazon's hit show "Fallout" said that wasn't the case in its AI-made synopsis of season one, released ahead of the hit show's new season next week. Fans quickly spotted factual errors, and Amazon Prime Video took down the recap.

One Redditor said the AI feature told viewers that a flashback featuring the Ghoul (one of the main characters, played by Walton Goggins) took place in the 1950s instead of 2077.

An X user posted that the recap also mischaracterized the agreement the Ghoul and Lucy MacLean (played by Ella Purnell) made in the "Fallout" finale.

Instead of saying the pair is teaming up to find Lucy's father, the recap said the Ghoul gave Lucy an ultimatum: "die or join him."

Amazon first launched its Video Recap, a feature that allows users to catch up on Prime Original TV shows between seasons, for beta testing in November.

"Video Recaps use AI to identify a show's most important plot points, combining them with synchronized voice narration, dialogue snippets, and music to create a visual summary that prepares viewers for the new season," the company said in a press release at the time.

The TV shows that Amazon said were undergoing Video Recaps testing — "Jack Ryan," "Upload," "Bosch," and "The Rig" — did not include the feature at the time of writing.

Representatives for Amazon did not respond to a request for comment from Business Insider.

Like so many companies, Amazon is investing heavily in AI.

During the company's February earnings call, Chief Finance Officer Brian Olsavsky said that 2025 capital expenditures could reach over $100 billion, with the majority of it going toward AI and Amazon Web Services, its cloud computing platform.

Many of Amazon's consumer services have integrated AI to enhance user engagement and experience, such as product suggestions and helping shoppers on its online platform find clothes that fit. In February, Amazon unveiled Alexa+, the next generation of Alexa, which is powered by generative AI to make it more conversational and personalized for users.

Embracing AI at Amazon, though, hasn't been without growing pains. In October, the company cited AI as it announced it would lay off 14,000 staff members.

"This generation of AI is the most transformative technology we've seen since the internet, and it's enabling companies to innovate much faster than ever before (in existing market segments and altogether new ones)," Beth Galetti, Amazon's senior vice president of people experience and technology, wrote in a blog post at the time.

In an internal message to the remaining staff, Amazon Vice President of Device Software and Services Tapas Roy asked them to "lean in on AI."

"Moving forward, we remain focused on our mission to help product teams launch delightful products," Roy wrote. "In support of this mission, I encourage you all to: Focus on the work that most directly impacts our customers, lean in on Al to enhance your effectiveness, [and] raise your hand when you see opportunities to simplify or eliminate unnecessary processes."
